stories.name: Sachin Verma
stories.shortDescription: Revived his father's spice business into a thriving enterprise
stories.fullStory: Sachin Verma revived his father Rajendra Verma's spice business that had declined due to market competition from factory-made brands. Starting with unbranded packets in 2013, Sachin officially registered Santosh Masala in 2018. During the COVID-19 pandemic, when larger spice manufacturers faced supply chain disruptions, Santosh Masala flourished by serving local markets in Kushinagar, Deoria, and Ballia districts.
achievements: Expanded product line to 9 varieties including vegetable masala, meat masala, red chili powder, and turmeric powder
Created employment for 9 individuals, including 4 women
Secured ₹10 lakh loan through Jagriti Enterprise Center (September 2023)
Purchased packaging machinery and essential equipment
Plans to introduce biryani and chana masala to product lineup
stories.quote: Transformed a 20-year-old family dream into a thriving enterprise within one year

stories.name: Sacchidanand Shahi
stories.shortDescription: Built a company with ₹5 million turnover from just ₹20,000
stories.fullStory: Sacchidanand's journey exemplifies determination overcoming financial constraints. Starting with just ₹20,000 after returning from Dubai during COVID-19, he built a company that achieved annual turnover exceeding ₹5 million within five years. After his first venture Riddhi-Siddhi Home Industries collapsed with ₹800,000 in losses, meeting Jagriti's enterprise leader Markandey Dayal Tripathi provided crucial mentorship to restart.
achievements: Founded Sarvdev Agro Pvt. Ltd in October 2022
Achieved annual turnover exceeding ₹5 million
Established distributors across Gorakhpur, Deoria, and Kushinagar districts
Planning ₹1.6 million investment in an oil mill creating 10+ jobs
stories.quote: Destiny favors those who breathe life into their dreams. It's not the wings but the willpower that makes us fly.

stories.name: Abhishek Kushwaha
stories.shortDescription: Young innovator who invented a patented digital walking stick
stories.fullStory: Abhishek's journey began at age 16 when his grandfather suffered a paralysis stroke. Watching his grandfather struggle sparked innovation - he designed a digital walking stick featuring eight technological features including emergency light, power bank, watch system, SD card music system, presence indication light, bell system, and charging system. The Indian government granted him a patent for this invention.
achievements: Received patent from Indian government for digital walking stick
Won 23+ awards including Bharat Gaurav Samman, Kishore Vaigyanik Samman
National Child Scientist Award recipient
105th Indian Science Congress Award
Developing science and engineering labs for ITIs and polytechnics
stories.quote: Every time his grandfather needed to move, Abhishek would hand him a walking stick and guide him by holding a torch ahead.
stories.location: Ramkaran Patti village, Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh

stories.name: Anita Rai
stories.shortDescription: Master trainer who empowered 600+ women in banana fiber production
stories.fullStory: Anita transformed from a homemaker into an entrepreneur after her husband's poultry business failed. She traveled to the National Research Center for Banana in Chennai for specialized training and was appointed as a master trainer. In 2022, she established Shree Mythili Enterprises, producing over 20 products including banana flour, chips, vermicelli, juice, and pickles.
achievements: Empowered 600+ women in banana fiber production
Created 150+ unique products from banana plants
Secured ₹1 lakh from Accenture and ₹2 lakh from Aavishkaar Foundation
Established pan-India market presence in Noida, Mumbai, Ghaziabad, Lucknow, Varanasi
stories.quote: Their support in improving product quality and connecting me to the right markets has been invaluable.

stories.name: Poonam
stories.shortDescription: From homemaker to camphor manufacturing entrepreneur
stories.fullStory: Poonam spent 15 years as a homemaker before COVID-19 devastated their family business. During the second wave in 2021, she researched online, watched YouTube tutorials, and proposed launching a camphor manufacturing venture. They established Gaurishankar Industries in March 2023, launching their flagship product Siddhi Aarti Kapoor.
achievements: Products distributed across Gorakhpur, Deoria, and Kushinagar districts
Expanded product line with multiple camphor sizes
Successfully transitioned from struggling venture to thriving enterprise
Plans to expand into complementary religious ritual products
stories.quote: My husband initially dismissed her input, believing she lacked business acumen. But persistence proved him wrong.

stories.name: Deepika Singh
stories.shortDescription: Artist turned terracotta jewelry entrepreneur employing 30 women
stories.fullStory: Deepika Singh's passion for painting led her from exhibiting at Raj Bhawan in Lucknow to establishing Atrangi Kalakari. After participating in Jagriti Yatra in 2022, she learned terracotta craftsmanship and now creates handcrafted jewelry combining artistic elegance with traditional clay work.
achievements: Employs 30 women artisans earning ₹5,000-₹10,000 monthly
Sells across India (Mumbai, Gujarat) and internationally
Product range includes terracotta jewelry, keychains, gift items
Featured at prestigious Raj Bhawan exhibition in Lucknow
stories.quote: Terracotta? It's just clay, it'll break - shopkeepers initially said, but Deepika overcame market skepticism.

stories.name: Kiran Sharma
stories.shortDescription: From childhood skill to leading 15 women artisans in moonj craft
stories.fullStory: Married at 17, mother of seven children, Kiran recalled her childhood skill of weaving munj grass baskets. In 2017, she met Jagriti team who connected her to Tech Shakti digital training. Today she leads 15 women artisans creating bread boxes, wall plates, bags, baskets, and gift items sold in Delhi, Mumbai, and UK.
achievements: Leads 15 women artisans
Earns ₹15,000-₹20,000 monthly
Products sold in Delhi, Mumbai, and UK
Gifted a handcrafted Ram figure to CM Yogi Adityanath
stories.quote: Never lose hope. If you have passion, helping hands will find their way. Keep your courage intact, and success will be yours.
